Fractalide-Releases.description: High level description of all releases.

releases.title: PASCAL
releases.description: The Pascal release represents the initial release of Hyperflow. It implements the basic infrastructure which allows the building and execution of Fractalide applications in Hyperflow.

features.title: Hyperflow MVP
Objectives: Fractalide.com website
Continuous Integration pipeline using Hydra; so users don't need to build dependencies
Racket2Nix: Wraps Racket packages and their transitive dependencies in Nix
Racket Flow-based programming scheduler
Node, agent and graph interfaces
Card Paradigm: a HyperCard inspired representation of GUI compositions using Flow-based programming
Node Mode displays a basic text editor; to write agent source code in
Graph Mode displays graphs as text only; to compose agents together into apps
Run Mode renders developed applications
Work Done: Racket2Nix: Wraps Racket packages in Nix
Card Paradigm: a HyperCard inspired representation of GUI compositions using Flow-based programming

features.title: Hyperflow Alpha
Objectives: Named Data Networking Layer for Apps
Node Mode includes a basic debugger
Improved Graph editing in graph mode, possibly with rudimentary graphical movable components
Improved UX by upgrading to GTK+ 3
Improve the graph language such that it'll write to a Nix expression

features.title: Hyperflow Beta
Objectives: Graph Mode Information flow debugger
Graphical construction of the graph
Support for multiple platforms (Mac OS, Linux and Windows 10)
Improved UX by creating a new GTK+ 3 CSS theme

features.title: Hyperflow Stable
Objectives: Extensive documentation is written
More items to add as we get closer to this release

releases.title: FIBONACCI
releases.description: The Fibonacci release builds out the first user facing Fractalide applications.

features.title: Cardano Wallet
Objectives: Stand alone Cardano Wallet implemented using the Card Paradigm, though it doesn't execute in Hyperflow
The same Cardano Wallet executes as an app within Hyperflow
